intro: Boerhavia crispa, commonly known as the crinkled billygoat weed, is a flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems that often lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are thin, crinkled, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Boerhavia crispa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
